q_spo_001.question: How many players are on a soccer team on the field?
q_spo_001.hint: Same as the number of players in a cricket team.
q_spo_001.explanation: Each soccer team fields 11 players including the goalkeeper.

q_spo_002.question: In which sport would you perform a slam dunk?
q_spo_002.hint: Michael Jordan and LeBron James are legends in this sport.
q_spo_002.explanation: A slam dunk is a basketball move where a player jumps and scores by putting the ball directly through the hoop.

q_spo_003.question: Which country has won the most FIFA World Cup titles?
q_spo_003.hint: Pelé played for this South American country's national team.
q_spo_003.explanation: Brazil has won the FIFA World Cup 5 times (1958, 1962, 1970, 1994, 2002).

q_spo_004.question: What is the highest score possible in 10-pin bowling?
q_spo_004.hint: A perfect game requires 12 consecutive strikes.
q_spo_004.explanation: A perfect game in bowling scores 300 points with 12 consecutive strikes.

q_spo_005.question: Which Grand Slam tennis tournament is played on clay courts?
q_spo_005.hint: Rafael Nadal has won this tournament a record number of times at Roland Garros.
q_spo_005.explanation: The French Open at Roland Garros is the only Grand Slam played on clay.

q_spo_006.question: How many rings are on the Olympic flag?
q_spo_006.hint: Each ring represents a continent that participates in the Olympic Games.
q_spo_006.explanation: The five Olympic rings represent the five continents: Africa, Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania.

q_spo_007.question: In which sport is a 'birdie' a term for one under par?
q_spo_007.hint: This sport is played on courses with 18 holes and uses clubs to hit a small ball.
q_spo_007.explanation: In golf, a birdie means completing a hole in one stroke fewer than par.

q_spo_008.question: Which country invented the sport of cricket?
q_spo_008.hint: This sport dates back to the 16th century and is the national summer sport of this country.
q_spo_008.explanation: Cricket originated in England in the late 16th century and spread through the British Empire.

q_spo_009.question: How long is a marathon in kilometers?
q_spo_009.hint: The distance was standardized at the 1908 London Olympics.
q_spo_009.explanation: A marathon is 42.195 km (26.2 miles), a distance set at the 1908 London Olympics to finish in front of the royal box.

q_spo_010.question: Which sport uses the largest playing field?
q_spo_010.hint: This sport is played on horseback and the field can be up to 275 meters long.
q_spo_010.explanation: A polo field is the largest playing field in organized sport, measuring up to 275 by 180 meters.

q_spo_011.question: In which sport is the term 'love' used to mean zero?
q_spo_011.hint: This sport uses an unusual scoring system: 15, 30, 40, and game.
q_spo_011.explanation: In tennis, 'love' means zero. The term may derive from the French 'l'oeuf' (egg), referring to the shape of zero.

q_spo_012.question: What is the national sport of Japan?
q_spo_012.hint: Wrestlers in this sport try to push their opponent out of a circular ring.
q_spo_012.explanation: Sumo is Japan's national sport with a history spanning over 1,500 years, deeply rooted in Shinto tradition.

q_spo_013.question: How many players are on a standard volleyball team on the court?
q_spo_013.hint: Players rotate positions each time their team wins the serve.
q_spo_013.explanation: Each volleyball team has 6 players on the court, rotating clockwise through positions after winning a rally.

q_spo_014.question: In which city were the first modern Olympic Games held in 1896?
q_spo_014.hint: This city is the capital of Greece, the birthplace of the ancient Olympics.
q_spo_014.explanation: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896, organized by Pierre de Coubertin and the IOC.

q_spo_015.question: In baseball, how many strikes make an out?
q_spo_015.hint: This rule is one of the most basic in the sport, often referenced as 'three strikes and you're out'.
q_spo_015.explanation: In baseball, a batter is called out after accumulating three strikes, a fundamental rule since the sport's early days.

q_spo_016.question: How many periods are in a standard ice hockey game?
q_spo_016.explanation: A standard ice hockey game consists of three 20-minute periods, totaling 60 minutes of play.

q_spo_017.question: In which sport do teams compete for the Stanley Cup?
q_spo_017.hint: This trophy was donated by the Governor General of Canada in 1892.
q_spo_017.explanation: The Stanley Cup is the championship trophy of the NHL (National Hockey League), the oldest professional sports trophy in North America.

q_spo_018.question: Which country has won the most Olympic gold medals in history?
q_spo_018.hint: This country has hosted the Summer Olympics four times.
q_spo_018.explanation: The United States has won over 1,000 Olympic gold medals across both Summer and Winter Games, more than any other country.

q_spo_019.question: How many points is a touchdown worth in American football?
q_spo_019.hint: After scoring this, a team can attempt an extra point kick for one more point.
q_spo_019.explanation: A touchdown is worth 6 points in American football. The team can then attempt an extra point (1 point) or a two-point conversion.

q_spo_020.question: Which country hosted the first FIFA World Cup in 1930?
q_spo_020.hint: This South American country also won the tournament that year.
q_spo_020.explanation: Uruguay hosted and won the first FIFA World Cup in 1930, defeating Argentina 4-2 in the final in Montevideo.

q_spo_021.question: What is the diameter of a standard basketball hoop in inches?
q_spo_021.hint: The rim is just slightly larger than twice the diameter of the basketball.
q_spo_021.explanation: A standard basketball hoop has an inner diameter of 18 inches (46 cm), while an NBA basketball has a diameter of about 9.4 inches.

q_spo_022.question: Which country won the first Rugby World Cup in 1987?
q_spo_022.hint: This country's rugby team is known as the All Blacks.
q_spo_022.explanation: New Zealand won the first Rugby World Cup in 1987, defeating France 29-9 in the final held in Auckland.

q_spo_023.question: What is the maximum break score in snooker?
q_spo_023.hint: This score requires potting all 15 reds with blacks, followed by all six colors.
q_spo_023.explanation: A maximum break of 147 in snooker is achieved by potting 15 reds (each followed by the black ball) and then all six colors in sequence.

q_spo_024.question: In which country did the martial art of judo originate?
q_spo_024.hint: Created by Jigoro Kano in 1882, this martial art's name means 'the gentle way' and has been an Olympic sport since 1964.
q_spo_024.explanation: Judo was created in Japan by Jigoro Kano in 1882 as a modern martial art derived from jujitsu. It became an Olympic sport at the 1964 Tokyo Games.

q_spo_025.question: Which martial art, known for its high kicks, originated in Korea and became an Olympic sport in 2000?
q_spo_025.hint: Its name means 'the way of the foot and fist,' and South Korea has won the most Olympic gold medals in this sport.
q_spo_025.explanation: Taekwondo originated in Korea in the 1940s–50s and became a full Olympic medal sport at the 2000 Sydney Games. It emphasizes head-height kicks, jumping, and spinning kicks.

q_spo_026.question: Which racket sport uses a shuttlecock instead of a ball?
q_spo_026.hint: Named after a country estate in England, this is the fastest racket sport — the projectile can travel over 400 km/h.
q_spo_026.explanation: Badminton uses a shuttlecock (also called a 'birdie'). The sport gets its name from Badminton House in Gloucestershire, England, where it was first played in the 19th century.

q_spo_027.question: Which Grand Slam tennis tournament is the only one played on grass courts?
q_spo_027.hint: Held annually in London, this tournament is famous for its strict all-white dress code and strawberries-and-cream tradition.
q_spo_027.explanation: Wimbledon, held at the All England Club in London since 1877, is the oldest tennis tournament and the only Grand Slam still played on grass courts.

q_spo_028.question: Which country has won the most ICC Cricket World Cup titles?
q_spo_028.hint: This country's cricket team, known for its green and gold colors, has dominated the tournament since the 1990s.
q_spo_028.explanation: Australia has won the ICC Cricket World Cup six times (1987, 1999, 2003, 2007, 2015, and 2023), more than any other country.

q_spo_029.question: Which swimmer has won the most Olympic gold medals in history?
q_spo_029.hint: This American swimmer earned his record-breaking medals across five consecutive Olympic Games from 2000 to 2016.
q_spo_029.explanation: Michael Phelps won 23 Olympic gold medals across five Games (2000–2016), making him the most decorated Olympic athlete of all time with 28 total medals.
